conclusion: Only sides ab and cd contribute to induced emf as they cut magnetic field lines.
Motional emf for a rotating conductor is dε = B ω r dr.
Side ab is at distances r from 0 to L/4; side cd is at distances r from L/4 to L/2.
Emf of side ab is ε_ab = B ω L² ⁄ 32.
Emf of side cd is ε_cd = 3 B ω L² ⁄ 32.
Instantaneous total emf for single-turn loop is ε_max(1 turn) = B ω L² ⁄ 8.
For N turns, peak emf is ε_max = N · (B ω L² ⁄ 8).
Effective (rms) value of induced emf is ε_rms = N (B ω L²) ⁄ (8√2).
